## Heterozygosity estimates

Claculating heterozygosity from an ANGSD generated SFS for just chromosome one of alle and vill to get rough idea of how diversity compares between spp. Takeaway -\> I don't think I can trust the absolute values and would want to do whole genome, also, sig diff number 'items' (sites I imagine) btw spp bc more alle than vill bams, so lower heteroz. of vill may just be because of that. All that said, it is clear I have greater representation of diersity in alle and it makes sense to subset alle for aHMM.

```{bash}
# quick angsd heterozygosity estimation 
# folded - unsure of ancestral state 
angsd -bam Aonly_bam.filelist -anc /hb/groups/kay_lab/genomes/C.lasius_genome_NCBI.fasta -dosaf 1 -gl 1 -C 50 -ref /hb/groups/kay_lab/genomes/C.lasius_genome_NCBI.fasta -minQ 20 -minmapq 20 -r Chrom1 -out alle_angsdput

#followed by the actual estimation
realSFS alle_angsdput.saf.idx >ALLE_est.ml
```

```{r}
# calculate heterozygosity
a <- scan("ANGSD/SFS_heterozygosity/ALLE_est.ml")
a[2]/sum(a) # 0.00305178
```

```{bash}
# quick angsd heterozygosity estimation 
# folded - unsure of ancestral state 
angsd -bam Vonly_bam.filelist -anc /hb/groups/kay_lab/genomes/C.lasius_genome_NCBI.fasta -dosaf 1 -gl 1 -C 50 -ref /hb/groups/kay_lab/genomes/C.lasius_genome_NCBI.fasta -minQ 20 -minmapq 20 -r Chrom1 -out vill_angsdput

# followed by the actual estimation
realSFS vill_angsdput.saf.idx >VILL_est.ml
```

```{r}
# calculate heterozygosity
v <- scan("ANGSD/SFS_heterozygosity/VILL_est.ml")
v[2]/sum(v) # 0.0002040093
```

#### Low error rate full run

Here, I ran all chromosomes with the full set of possible parents (more allenii than vill). I used the same parameters as the second successful test: vcf2aHMM:--rate 1 --minGT 1 --minDif 0.1 --dist 1000 --minDP 1 run_aHMM:-a 2 0.5 0.5 -p 0 100000 0.5 -p 1 1 0.5 -e 1e-3

Note the very low error rate in the aHMM line - this is to help pick up misperforming sites and should be increased to \~0.02 for the real analysis. I ran all hybrids, but also all parentals through aHMM to look at how parentals were called (and identify bad sites). \##### Hybrids
